featured.text: The problem of illegal drug use is very complex and cannot be traced to merely one _____ reason.
The association of particular patterns with individual families can be traced back hundreds of years.
Despite their great 28 , however, most domesticated apples can be traced back to a common ancestor, the wild apple of Central Asia, Malus sieversii.
Although the term did not emerge until the 18th century, toy hoops twirled around the waist, limbs, or neck can be traced back to ancient times.
In order to draw her family tree, Mary tried to trace her back to their arrival in North America.

definition.en_def: To follow the course or development of something; a mark or evidence left behind.
definition.example: The detective found a trace of the suspect's footprints in the mud.
